text: Authors in Focus was a British television series which aired in 1949 on the BBC. In each episode, a book would be discussed by a "spokesman" and a critic. Four episodes were produced. The books discussed were The Triple Challenge by Francis Williams,http://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/schedules/bbctv/1949-02-04#at-21.30 The Theory of the Leisure Class by Thorstein Veblenhttp://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/schedules/bbctv/1949-03-04#at-21.05 Time was Away by Alan Ross,http://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/schedules/bbctv/1949-04-01#at-20.15 and Managers, Men and Morale by Wilfred Brown and Winifred Raphael.http://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/schedules/bbctv/1949-04-29#at-21.45 It should not be confused with a 1954 series which had the same title, but with a different format. ==References== ==External links== *Authors in Focus on IMDb Category:1940s British television series Category:1949 British television series debuts Category:1949 British television series endings Category:Lost BBC episodes Category:BBC Television shows Category:Black-and-white British television shows
